item.title: Predicate
item.description: Definition In logic, a predicate is a mathematical statement or assertion that may be either true or false. Properties Weaker and Stronger Predicates Let $P$ and $Q$ be two predicates.

item.title: Lambda Calculus
item.description: Definition Lambda calculus (also written as $\lambda$-calculus) is a formal system for expressing computations based on function abstraction (defining and expressing $\lambda$-terms, also called $\lambda$-expressions) and function application (applying functions to arguments).

item.title: Gamma Function
item.description: Definition The gamma function is an extension of the factorial function to complex numbers, and is defined for all complex numbers except for non-positive integers.
